title: FLACC Scale (Pediatric) Schema
description:
Implement FLACC Pain Scale Assessment Schema

Create a structured schema to capture and calculate FLACC (Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability) pain scale assessments for pediatric and non-verbal patients.

Requirements:
- Define schema for the five FLACC behavioral categories:
  * Face: Scoring 0-2 (no expression to constant grimace/jaw clenched)
  * Legs: Scoring 0-2 (normal position to kicked/legs drawn up)
  * Activity: Scoring 0-2 (lying quietly to arched/rigid/jerking)
  * Cry: Scoring 0-2 (no cry to steady cry/screams/sobs)
  * Consolability: Scoring 0-2 (content to difficult to console)
- Calculate total score (0-10 range) from individual category scores
- Include metadata fields: patient ID, assessment timestamp, assessor ID
- Add interpretation guidelines (0=relaxed/comfortable, 1-3=mild discomfort, 4-6=moderate pain, 7-10=severe pain)
- Store assessment history for tracking pain trends over time
- Ensure schema supports both pediatric patients and non-verbal adults
- Include validation rules to ensure scores are within valid ranges
- Add optional notes field for qualitative observations

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Patients with limited mobility affecting Legs/Activity scoring
- Sedated patients where some behaviors may be suppressed
- Cultural differences in pain expression
- Baseline behavioral patterns that may affect scoring accuracy
